titleStmt.title: Dawit “Psalter”/ Ṣälotat zä-maʿalt wä-zä-lelit “Prayers for the Day and for the Night Hours” / Raʾǝyä Yoḥannǝs “Revelation of John”

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.rubric:
Nomina sacra (name of St. Mary in Texts I-4, I-5 and II); title of Texts I-2, I-3; numbers and titles of the Pss., Canticles and Songs; incipit of the daily readings of Text I-4; incipit of sections of Text II; refrains of Texts I-4, I-5 and II (written out fully or abbreviated); names of Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; stichometry; word እገሌ፡ in Text II; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numeral or their elements.
A few lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Texts I-1, I-2 and II; a few lines (alternating with black lines) of the incipit of each Canticle and Song; a few lines (alternating with black lines) of the daily readings of Text I-4, of the incipit of Text I-5 and of the incipit of the text on fol. 149v.

msItem.note: - Text II, Ṣälotat zä-maʿalt wä-zä-lelit “Prayers for the Day and for the Night Hours”, is similar to that contained in Ms. Vat. Aeth. 21 (15th cent.), fols. 6v-16v, 33v-40 (GréTisVat I,85-110, esp. 86-96). For more information s. also EAE V, 501-03.
- Traditional titles of the Pss. are missing.
- Traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters in Ps. 118 is missing.

- Stichometry (number of lines for each Ps./number of lines for a group of ten Pss.) is indicated by the word ቃሉ/ቃሉ: ለ፲፡ መዝሙር followed by a number, written in red or black (e.g., fols. 26r, 28r, respectively).

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 172.0 folios, of which blank 2v, 3v, 4v, 5v, 125v, 172rv, in 22.0 quires .
31.2 20.4 11.4

list.item:
6
XXII(6/fols. 167r-172v).
The quire structure cannot be exactly determined. Fol. 155, crudely sewn onto quire XX, comes from a different Ms. Fol. 156 is of a different size (possibly coming from a different Ms.).

supportDesc.condition: The Ms. has been resewn with recent synthetic threads. A new back board has been installed. Many fols. are affected by water and humidity, that is why some parts of text are hardly readable: e.g. fols. 37r, 147v, 148r, 157r, 167r, 171v. Some fols. are probably missing, some are misplaced (fols. 148, 150 (?), 154, 166). Fol. 168 is cut and part of the text (left bottom corner) is lost. Holes carefully amended on fols. 52, 83, 115, 130. Holes crudely amended by recent threads on fols. 70, 77, 155.

layout.note: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data are for fol. 7r.
layout.ab: Ruling and pricking are partly visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

layout.note: Texts I-4, I-5, II: all data are for fol. 148r.
layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

layout.note: Text III: all data are for fol. 155r.
layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

list.item: Sign ዝየ (written as a ligatur) occurs frequently to the left of a line of the Pss.
Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain.
ሠረቀ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 157va-158ra)
እስ፡/እስመ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 158rb-159va)
ኵሉ፡ for ኵሉ፡ ትውልድ፡ ያስተበፅዑኪ፡ ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ (fols. 159vb-161ra)
ናዓ፡ for ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። እስመ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ይኵን፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵልነ (fols. 161va-162vb)
ለኪ፡ for ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እመ፡ ብርሃን፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ በስብሐት፡ ወበውዳሴ (fols. 163ra-164ra)
ተ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ (fols. 164ra-164vb)
ወበእንተዝ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fol. 154ra, 165rb-vb)
The abbreviation stand for the whole refrain.
ወበእንተዝ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 169ra-171va)

handDesc.handNote: The handwriting presents the features of period late 14th – mid-15th cent. (Period II, s. UhlPal).
Numeral ፮ “six” is of two kinds, looking like a compressed numeral ፯ “seven” (fols. 7v l.17, 15r l.16, 24v l.2) and being closer to the modern form.

decoDesc.decoNote: Fol. 6r (Incipit of Text I-1): elaborate coloured (black, red, yellow, green) ornamental frame; interlaces.
Fol. 126r (Incipit of Text I-2): elaborate coloured (black, red, yellow) ornamental frame; interlaces, floral motifs.
Fol. 139r (Incipit of Text I-3): elaborate coloured (black, red, yellow) ornamental frame; interlaces.
Fols. 146v-147r (Incipit of Text II): elaborate coloured (black, red, yellow, green) ornamental frames; interlaces, geometric motifs.
Fol. 168r (Incipit of Text I-5): elaborate coloured (black, red, yellow) ornamental frame; interlaces.

- Simple coloured (black, red, yellow, green) ornamental bands; interlaces, geometric and floral motifs. They separate Canticles and Songs from each other (in Text I-1 the exceptions are Pss. 17, 47, 49, 51-59, 61-66, 120, 122-127, 132, 133, 135, 137, 138, 140, 142-145, 148).
- Elaborate coloured (black, red, yellow, green) ornamental bands; interlaces, geometric and floral motifs. They separate groups of ten Psalms.

list.item:
Fol. 1r: Incipit of the Prayer of Mary on Golgota.Fol. 1r: በስመ”…ዛቲ፡ ጸሎት፡ ዘጸለየት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ንጽሕት፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡ እሙ፡ ለብርሃን፡ ጸሎታ፡ ወበረከታ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ገብረ፡ ጻድቅ፡ ለአለመ፡ አለም፡ አሜን፡ ጸሎተ፡ ዘጸለየት፡ አመ፡ ፳፩ ለወርኃ፡ ሰኔ፡
The prayer is written in a crude hand, in brown ink. It mentions Gäbrä Ṣadǝq. For the Prayer of Mary on Golgota s. BassAp [V].

Fol. 138v: An extract from a work of monastic literature.Fol.138v: በእንተ፡ ገዳም፡ ወመጽአ፡ ኀቤሁ፡ አሐዱ፡ እኀነ፡ ወይቤሎ፡ ንግረኒ፡ በ[ዘ፡] አሐዩ፡ ቃለ፡ ከመ፡ እዘክሮ፡ ሶበ፡ ይመጽአኒ፡ ሕሊና፡ እኩይ፡ ውስተ፡ ልብየ፡ ገዳምኑ፡ ይኄይሰኒ፡ ነቢረ፡ ወሚመ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ እግዚአብኤር፡…
The text is written in a much later hand than the main texts.

Separate leaf of paper placed between the last folio and the back board: Record concerning the property of the monastery of Däbrä Dammo (?).
The record is written in Tǝgrǝñña.

- A fragment of a chant (Dǝggwa?) manuscript is glued to the inner side of the back board - The midpoint of the “Psalms of David” (in Ps. 77) is marked (together with a few more verses preceding and following it) with an arrow on fol. 66v l.19-20-66v l.1-23. - The scribe used compressed script on fol. 133v. - Part of the line is taken up (on many fols. throughout the Ms.): e.g., fols. 6r, 7r, 7v, 9r, 10v, 13v, 22v, 23v, 24v, 25v, 29v, 31r, 34r, 35v, 41v, 48v, 50v, 57v, 63r, 65r, 69v, 73r, 75r, 76v, 78v, 79r, 80v, 81r, 84v, 87r, 96v, 97v, 99r, 100r, 101r, 102v, 104r, 105v, 109v, 111r, 112r, 113v, 115r, 126r, 128v, 130r, 135r, 142r, 143r. - Part of the line is taken down (on many fols. throughout the Ms.): e.g., fols. 24v, 25r, 30v, 31v, 32r, 33r, 37v, 55v, 56r, 57v, 59r, 65v, 73r, 78v, 97r, 100r, 109v, 110v, 117v, 133r, 137r, 143v. - Omitted letters, words, lines or passages written interlineally or in the margins, in the main hand and in a secondary hand: fols. 7r, 9v, 16v, 41v, 44r, 53v, 54r, 57r, 62r, 63r, 75v, 79v, 81r, 83v, 90v, 92v, 94v, 97r, 100v, 101v, 102v, 113v, 115v, 119v, 122v, 125r, 128v, 130r, 132r, 135v, 136r, 155vb, 170va, 171r. - Corrections written over erasures, in the main hand and in secondary hands: fols. 6v, 14v, 24v, 32v, 35r, 39r, 40v, 43v, 48r, 49r, 59r, 69r, 69v, 73v, 74r, 76r, 77r, 78v, 79v, 82r, 85r, 92v, 93v, 95v, 97r, 97v, 127v, 128r, 130r, 131r, 132r, 133r, 137r, 149b, 150ra, 151r, 153ra, 154ra, 162va, 163vab, 164vb, 168va, 171vb. - Erasures marked with thin lines: fols. 61r, 62r, 69r, 70r, 73v, 74r, 75v, 76v, 78v, 82r, 84v, 85r, 98r, 98v, 125r, 129r, 130r, 132r, 137r, 144v, 154ra, 162va. - Erasures: 11r, 24v, 25r, 98v, 125r, 157v, 158ra, 159va, 164vab, 168vb, 169r, 169v. - Minor notes, writing exercises, doodles, scribbles: fols. 1v, 6v, 8v, 16r, 17r, 22r, 25r, 37v, 52v, 71r, 73v, 79r, 80r, 81r, 91r, 153r, 156r, 157r, 157v, 158r, 159v, 160r, 161r (interlineally), 165r, 166r, 169r, 170r, 172r.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown leather (half cover). Two pairs of sewing station.

Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover. All quires are reinforced by parchment guards of different sizes (on both the spine fold and centre fold). The last fol., verso side, shows some discolouration and was possibly used as a pastedown.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: Gäbrä Ṣadǝq is mentioned in Additio 1.
